placeMetadata.name: Nature Information Centre

sources.snippet: You can also paddleboat Vihar and Tulsi Lakes, and learn about the different species of resident wildlife through one of the Nature Information Center's guided activities. The center's butterfly garden is also a popular park destination.
sources.shortName: Sanjay Gandhi National Park: The Complete Guide

placeMetadata.address: Nature Information Center, Sanjay Gandhi National Park, National Park - Kanheri Caves Rd, Rajendra Nagar Society, Kulupwadi, Borivali East, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400066, India

reviews.reviewText: NIC Nature Information Centre is best for activities and trails related to nature. Trails in Sanjay Gandhi National Park conducted by NIC. Other Nature conservation activities are also conducted by NIC.
I visited Mumbai's highest point nature trail trek at Sanjay Gandhi National Park in this year's monsoon season. Nature education officers guided the tour & the foggy view at the end was mesmerizing.

NIC is doing good work by conducting various activities in Sanjay Gandhi National Park. On 5th June 2019 we went for World Environment Day Marathon in Sanjay Gandhi National Park which was organised by NIC. It was for children age between 6 to 16 and my kid enjoyed it. They organise different types of activities around the year.

Nature Information Centre of SGNP- Borivali is really a good place for Tourists and Wildlife Enthusiasts. This place has got a Control room where all the Trails and Upcoming events are discussed and shared. There's a AV room for presentation purpose which can accommodate around 70 people. There is a 3D model of the Park. One can go through a Gallery of images of all key species that can be found in Maharashtra.

This place is at Borivali inside Sanjay Gandhi National Park. This Nature Information Centre is a area in National Park dedicated to different types of plants and natural resources but specially forest plants and all those which is there in SGNP. so if you visit Borivali then it's obvious to go to SGNP and if you are here then you should rome here also. Thanks✌🏼🙂

I've been to this place multiple times to cycle till the Kanahari caves.
You should start early morning and can rent a cycle or take a walk.
Cycles are easy to rent with both official and private vendors available.
Official rate is rs80 for 2 hrs but private vendors take rs80 per hour.
Recommend Going upto the Kanahari caves which has a small fee of rs25 per person.

Nature information centre is near Main gate of Sanjay Gandhi National Park adjoining western express highway in Borivli ,here you can get information of whole of the national park and activities which are available to nature lover eg shilonda trail,gomukh trail,Ashokvan trail,adjascent to this is Brandits park also called butterfly garden .
Tickets and all type of information available here

placeMetadata.name: Shree Neminath Bhagwan Digambar Jain Temple

sources.snippet: In the forest, there is a famous Jain temple called Trimurti. This temple is widely visited by Digambar sect of the Jain community. It has three huge idols of lord Adinathh and his two sons, lord Bahubali and lord Bharat.
sources.shortName: Sanjay Gandhi National Park | Mumbai Wiki

placeMetadata.address: 3WM5+3PW, RB Mehta Marg, Saibaba Nagar, Pant Nagar, Ghatkopar East, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400077, India

reviews.reviewText: If you are in the Mumbai, especially in Ghatkopar; you shouldn't miss visiting this Jain temple. Even if you are not a Jain, visit this beautiful temple. Everything is built using marbles including facades, sculptures, floors etc. The temple has 3 floors and has a lift for elderly people. You get blessed with peace when you enter in and get into the hall where prayers and pooja takes place. You also get a good view of the surrounding area from the top floor.

One of the beat temple in ghatkopar east ,
One of the most important thing about jain temple is you will find completw silence here.
And silence is sometimes best medicne for peace of mind.
I love to visit placees of worship where there is silence
Very Beautiful Digamber Jain Temple in Ghatkopar East area, it has Jin Mandir on base floor, Swadhyay Temple on 1st Floor & Samavsharan on 2nd Floor.
Very beautiful digambar jain temple with Darshan on 3 floors.

Great Temple in the heart of Ghatkopar.
Termed as First Digambar Jain Temple in Ghatkopar.
Visit for many Great Monuments & Temples of Digambar Jain. i.e. Samavasaran (Name of Temple)
Truly God place where you can listen future tirthankar Vani 2 times a day morning 8:30 am to 9:30 am and in the evening 7:45 to 8:45
This place is very peacefull and in good location main road and here you can listen pravachan of kanji swami also
Great experience while being inside.

ops.insert: Ancient temples, hewn from rock, with Buddhist shrines, paintings of Buddha and 109 entrances.
Sprawling, forested park home to the ancient Kanheri Caves, a lion & tiger safari & nature trails.
Research centre with a library, gift shop & rare animal & insect specimens viewable by appointment.
Tranquil, leafy garden home to nectar plants with flowers attracting colorful butterflies.
National park trail stretching 2.5 miles accessed by guided tours teeming with birdlife & insects.

Borivali is a suburb located in northwestern Mumbai, India. Traditionally, tribals and East Indians lived in Borivali.
Attractions include Sanjay Gandhi National Park, fish park, Kanheri Caves, Mandapeshwar Caves, Water Kingdom, the Rushivan and Hanuman Tekdi with views of the suburbs. Wikipedia.

Thane is a city just outside Mumbai, in the western Indian state of Maharashtra. It’s known as the ‘City of Lakes’, and its more than 30 lakes include tree-lined Upvan Lake, a popular recreational spot. Beside Talao Pali Lake, Kopineshwar Mandir is an old, domed Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. To the west, leopards, monkeys and parakeets inhabit the teak forest and bamboo groves of Sanjay Gandhi National Park.
Island with an ornately sculpted, 7th-century cave temple dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.
Tranquil garden offering views of the Arabian Sea, flowers & hedges sculpted into animal shapes.

Verdant Malabar Hill is an upscale residential area known for the Hanging Gardens, a hillside park with sea views and hedges sculpted into animal shapes. At the Walkeshwar temple complex, Banganga Tank is a sacred pool with 12th-century origins. Other sights include the ancient Babulnath Mandir temple, reached by climbing over 100 steps, and Babu Amichand Panalal Jain Temple, embellished with intricate carvings.
19th-century artificial lake featuring boating, fishing & several parks along its shores.

Aarey Milk Colony is within Sanjay Gandhi National Park. Of which 25.6% are classified as mixed moist deciduous type forest. It acts as a buffer between SGNP and the city, being one of the few green spaces left in Mumbai. Wikipedia.
Dating to the mid-1st century, these Hindu & Buddhist cave temples feature intricate carvings.

Yeoor is a hilly area in Thane city of Maharashtra state in India. Situated in the Sanjay Gandhi National Park, it is known for its panthers and wildlife and is popularly known as "Mumbai's National Park".
Yeoor has 6 villages, and houses a population of around 3000. Wikipedia.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Just a stone's throw away from the bustling streets of Mumbai, nature lovers can find a refreshing escape in the city's stunning national parks. Among these, Sanjay Gandhi National Park stands out as a lush oasis, offering a unique blend of wildlife, history, and adventure. Imagine wandering through ancient Buddhist caves, like the Kanheri Caves, which date back to the 1st century BCE, all while surrounded by the vibrant flora and fauna that call this park home. Whether you're looking to spot a tiger or simply enjoy a peaceful row-boat ride along the Mithi River, this park has something for everyone.

But the wonders of nature don't stop there. Just beyond the city limits, you'll discover hidden gems like Bamboo Garden Chinese Cuisine, nestled within a sprawling bamboo plantation, where you can savor delicious meals in a serene setting. For those seeking a bit of thrill, the Tiger and Lion Safari offers an exciting glimpse into the lives of these majestic creatures. With so much to explore, it's time to lace up your hiking boots and dive into the natural beauty that surrounds Mumbai.
